channel.title: [Q] Two Questions
channel.description:
Okay so I have 2 questions that need to be answered if anyone can help. [u] [b]Questions[/b][/u] [ul][li]How to change the IP address of the server so when people try to connect, they connect to my IP address. Not 127.0.0.1[/li] [li]How to fix this error I get when I try to compile a .java file:
'javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . .
[/li][/ul] It would be greatly appreciated if anyone could help me. Thanks.

item.title: [Q] Two Questions
item.dc:creator: @snoopy89 snoopy89
item.description:
@snoopy89 wrote:

[quote=“Kryptix, post:1, topic:328918”]I presume you’re using EasyRSC (or NOOBScape, which is basically EasyRSC) so you will need to open ‘server.java’ and change 127.0.0.1 (or localhost) to your internal IP (such as 192.168.1.1). You will then need to open your routers settings that you’re presumably sat behind and port forward the port you’re using (probably 43594) to the IP on your network that the server is hosted on.

‘javac’ is the Java compiler (JDK). You will need to download and install Java JDK. If you’ve already done then you will need to setup your Java path.[/quote]

your wrong. JDK isnät needed, easier way is to use apache ant and download tool.jar.

Read full topic

item.title: [Q] Two Questions
item.dc:creator: @chandler707 chandler707
item.description:
@chandler707 wrote:

Okay so I have 2 questions that need to be answered if anyone can help.

Questions

[ul][li]How to change the IP address of the server so when people try to connect, they connect to my IP address. Not 127.0.0.1[/li]
[li]How to fix this error I get when I try to compile a .java file:

'javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . .
[/li][/ul]

It would be greatly appreciated if anyone could help me.
Thanks.
